result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick A Uecke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant granted payment plan of $100/month commencing 4/1/2022 for fine, costs, atty's fees and restitution. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant to submit a DNA sample at the Ozaukee County Sheriff's Department.

The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: No contact with Mequon Kwik Trip. Absolute sobriety.   Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.

01:08 PM Defendant Patrick A Uecke via video conference from the Ozaukee County Jail with attorney Rachel Marie Boaz as a friend of the court.  Defendant in custody. Matthew Vincent Nugent appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for PD. Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends signature bond w/conditions. Court advises of right to counsel.  Arraignment scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
